segments.text: I see the woman standing there, completely absorbed in her task of drying the plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost comical how unaware she is of the water cascading over the sink and onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little anxious watching the puddle grow beneath her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her calm demeanor seems to contrast so starkly with the potential chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy reaching into the cookie jar, teetering on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can he not see how unstable he is?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there’s the little girl, eagerly waiting for her cookie, her arm outstretched.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a sight that should be adorable, but I feel a knot in my stomach instead.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a recipe for disaster, yet it’s also so mundane.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the mess she’s creating and the danger it poses.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so at peace with her task that it’s almost unsettling.
segments.speaker: PAR
